intro: Penicillaria chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese penicillaria, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. Penicillaria chinensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
